derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (as a term in rhetoric denoting a section of a complex sentence, or a pause before it): via Latin from Greek kōlon 'limb, clause'
late Middle English: via Latin from Greek kolon

entry.def: A colon is the  punctuation mark : which you can use in several ways. For example, you can put it before a list of things or before reported speech.
Your colon is the part of your intestine above your rectum.

means.word_mean: 1. the part of the large intestine between the cecum and the rectum; it extracts moisture from food residues before they are excreted
2. the basic unit of money in El Salvador; equal to 100 centavos
3. the basic unit of money in Costa Rica; equal to 100 centimos
4. a punctuation mark (:) used after a word introducing a series or an example or an explanation (or after the salutation of a business letter)
